Articles.Content:
I don't think this has been talked about in a while, which is a shame. So I thought I would start a post about it. This is about our old friend, the Magic Boulder. For those that don't know, it was an easter egg that vanished from the game several versions ago. It most likely was accidental.

So, does anyone have any fond memories of Magic Boulder?

Does anyone think it should be added back into the game?

Does anyone think it will return?

Edited June 14, 2014 by bsalis
Yeah, it should be readded to the game but as an asteroid that will spawn randomly in places.

Magic boulder would make sense as one of plenty possible captured asteroids and minor moons that would orbit other planets (mostly gas giants), discovery mechanics and asteroids probably could allow to generate hundreds of asteroids and minor planets (fancy name for slightly bigger rock) orbiting all over the system, waiting to be discovered.

step 2: take to ike

step 2: take to ike

It's been done.
There should be a .1% (if not less) chance of an asteroid to contain Derpium, causing it to glow green.
Ah, heck, it might be planned for it to spawn instead of a normal asteroid. There are already "potatoroids", so why not?
Only time I visited it was in .17.1... I want it back.
Tiberium!!!!! IN THE NAM OF KANE XD
I miss the Magic Boulder, it was the most enigmatic easter egg imo.
Now that we have coloured lights, it someone could attach green ones to an asteroid and make it look more like our favourite departed Boulder.
What if it's still in the game, but it now orbits outside the solar system (larger orbit than Jool)? I mean, it is magic afterall.

Now that would be good. Squad announce that .24 includes a new Magic Boulder, somewhere within 150 Gm of the Sun, and the community are challenged to find it. And of course it's been implemented so it can't be easily revealed by mods.

Good times. We all have enjoyed a lot the mystery sence created by NovaSilico around the Boulder...
